summary: Fix timeline zoom by changing overflow:auto to overflow:hidden and add zoom controls toolbar
context: The timeline view under the Decisions tab had a zoom bug: once zoomed in, users couldn't zoom back out to see a larger timescale. The root cause was overflow:auto on #timeline-container which created a scrollable container that intercepted scroll wheel events before vis-timeline could process them for zoom.
rationale: overflow:hidden lets vis-timeline handle all scroll/zoom internally without interference. Added explicit zoom controls (zoom in/out, fit all, jump to now) as a secondary zoom mechanism so users are never stuck. Also added domain swim lanes, domain filter chips, gradient confidence-coded items, custom dark tooltips, and entrance animations for visual polish.

alternatives.option: Use zoomKey option to require ctrl+scroll for zoom
alternatives.reason_rejected: Doesn't fix the root overflow issue and adds friction to zooming. Users expect scroll-to-zoom on a timeline.

alternatives.option: Replace vis-timeline with a custom canvas-based timeline
alternatives.reason_rejected: Massive overengineering for a bug fix. vis-timeline works well once the overflow conflict is resolved.
